Data Structures | Macros | Functions | Variables
DCU - Debug Control Unit
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for managing the Debug Control Unit (DCU) which controls debug access and security features on Apollo5 devices. It handles DCU locking, unlocking, status checking, and configuration for secure debug operations.

Key Features

  1. Debug Control: Manage debug access permissions and security.
  2. Lock/Unlock: Control DCU locking mechanisms for security.
  3. Status Monitoring: Check DCU status and configuration.
  4. Security Management: Handle debug security features.
  5. Raw Access: Direct access to DCU registers and masks.

Functionality

  • Lock and unlock DCU for security control
  • Read DCU status and configuration
  • Manage debug access permissions
  • Handle raw DCU register access
  • Support for security override operations

Usage

  1. Check DCU status using am_hal_dcu_get()
  2. Lock/unlock DCU as needed for security
  3. Monitor DCU configuration and status
  4. Handle security overrides when required

Configuration

  • Security Level: Configure debug access permissions
  • Lock Masks: Set up DCU locking patterns
  • Override Support: Enable security override features

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_dcu_get()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_get ( uint32_t * pui32Val)

Read DCU Enables (Qualified Values)

Parameters
pui32Val- Pointer to Mask for returned data

This will get the current DCU Enable settings

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_dcu_lock()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_lock ( uint32_t ui32Mask)

Write DCU Lock (Qualified Values)

Parameters
ui32Mask- Mask for lock values

This will lock the DCU from further changes

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_dcu_lock_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_lock_status_get ( uint32_t * pui32Val)

Read DCU Lock.

Parameters
pui32Val- Pointer to word for returned data (Qualified DCU Mask)

This will retrieve the DCU Lock information

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_dcu_mcuctrl_override()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_mcuctrl_override ( uint32_t ui32Mask)

DCU Disable - Using MCUCTRL Override.

Parameters
ui32Mask- DCU controls to be modified (Qualified Values)

This will update the MCUCTRL DCU Disable Override settings This can only further lock things if the corresponding DCU Enable was open

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_dcu_swo_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_swo_enable ( void )

DCU SWO Enable - Enable SWO.

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_dcu_update()

uint32_t am_hal_dcu_update ( bool bEnable,
uint32_t ui32Mask )

Update DCU Enable (Qualified Values)

Parameters
ui32Mask- DCU controls to be modified
bEnable- Whether to enable or disable

This will update the DCU Enable settings, if not locked

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success
